intro: Lappula heteracantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lappula, is a flowering plant in the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is typically found in dry, disturbed soils and is native to regions of Europe and Asia. Lappula heteracantha is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
